page.title: 05STREAMS NEAR ST.WENN
page.content: In our St Wenn area we have over {eight and a half miles}of streams flowing roughly in straight lines to the{north}where they meet bigger streams or rivers flowing to the{east. The pattern of the streams on a map looks like a letter{T}with smaller{ts joining it. It is like a trellised pattern. We have twelve{springs}but only one {pond}in this D. block.There is one old {mill}race which is all over-grown and three old {water-mills. } There are eight{foot-bridges}and there are two{fords.}There are nine {stone}bridges.They are simple{beam bridges because the streams and rivers are shallow and easy to span. Our streams and rivers are wonderful {habitats}for{fish,amphibians,insects and{birds.}Their banks are full of trees, shrubs and rich undergrowth.
